verses.text: How amiable \add are\add* thy tabernacles, O \sc Lord\sc* of hosts!
My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the \sc Lord\sc*: My heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
Yea, the sparrow hath found a house, And the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, \add Even\add* thine altars, O \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, my King, and my God.
Blessed \add are\add* they that dwell in thy house: They will be still praising thee. Selah.
Blessed \add is\add* the man whose strength \add is\add* in thee; In whose heart \add are\add* the ways \add of them\add*.
\add Who\add* passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; The rain also filleth the pools.
They go from strength to strength, \add Every one of them\add* in Zion appeareth before God.
O \sc Lord\sc* God \add of\add* hosts, hear my prayer: Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Behold, O God our shield, And look upon the face of thine anointed.
For a day in thy courts \add is\add* better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, Than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For the \sc Lord\sc* God \add is\add* a sun and shield: The \sc Lord\sc* will give grace and glory: No good \add thing\add* will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
O \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Blessed \add is\add* the man that trusteth in thee.
